title: Radhanagari Wildlife Sanctuary
subtitle: A Haven for the Mighty Indian Bison
overview: Radhanagari Wildlife Sanctuary, also known as Dajipur Sanctuary, is one of Maharashtra’s most scenic and biodiverse protected areas, nestled in the Sahyadri ranges of the Western Ghats.
Spread over 351 square kilometers in Kolhapur district, the sanctuary is famed for its population of the Indian Bison (Gaur), lush green forests, and picturesque landscapes.
Declared a World Heritage Site by UNESCO, it’s a paradise for nature lovers, photographers, and wildlife enthusiasts alike.

highlights.title: Home of the Indian Bison
highlights.description: Radhanagari is renowned for its large herds of Gaur, often spotted grazing in open meadows.

highlights.title: Radhanagari Dam and Lakes
highlights.description: Picturesque water bodies like Radhanagari and Kalammawadi dams enhance the sanctuary’s charm.

geography.intro: Located about 55 km from Kolhapur, Radhanagari Wildlife Sanctuary lies in the Sahyadri hill ranges, characterized by dense forests, hills, and water reservoirs.

climate.description: Radhanagari experiences a moderate climate with heavy rainfall during monsoon and pleasant winters.

seasons.text: Monsoon (June–September): Forests turn lush green; perfect for scenic beauty lovers.
Winter (October–February): Ideal for wildlife safaris and birdwatching.

geography.conclusion: With its tranquil forests, thriving wildlife, and scenic lakes, Radhanagari offers a refreshing experience for every nature enthusiast.

activities.title: Wildlife Safari
activities.description: Embark on jeep safaris to witness the sanctuary’s rich fauna including the majestic Indian Bison.
info: Morning safaris offer better chances of animal sightings.
Permits are available at the forest office near Dajipur.

activities.title: Nature Trails
activities.description: Explore scenic trails passing through dense forests, rivers, and hilly terrains.
info: Popular trails lead to the Radhanagari Dam viewpoint and scenic ridges.
Best visited post-monsoon for clear visibility.

activities.title: Photography
activities.description: Capture mesmerizing landscapes, wildlife, and waterfalls within the sanctuary.
info: Ideal lighting during early mornings and evenings.
Carry zoom lenses for bird and wildlife photography.

attractions.title: Radhanagari Dam
attractions.description: A scenic dam built across the Bhogawati River offering panoramic views and serene surroundings.

attractions.title: Sunset Point
attractions.description: A popular viewpoint overlooking the lush valleys and reservoir, offering stunning sunset views.

marineLife.intro: Though the sanctuary is landlocked, its aquatic systems support a range of freshwater species.

items.title: Freshwater Fish
items.description: Numerous fish species inhabit the reservoirs and rivers within the sanctuary.

items.title: Birdlife
items.description: Home to hornbills, kingfishers, and herons that thrive near water bodies.

conclusion: Radhanagari’s ecosystem sustains a rich web of aquatic and terrestrial life.
It is a key conservation site for Western Ghats biodiversity.

howToReach.title: By Road
details: Located 55 km from Kolhapur and 440 km from Mumbai.
Regular state transport buses and private taxis are available.

howToReach.title: By Rail
details: From Kolhapur, local buses or jeeps are available to Dajipur gate.

bookingTips.description: Best time to visit: October to February for pleasant weather and clear trails.
Obtain entry permits from the Dajipur forest office before the safari.
Avoid visiting during heavy monsoon due to slippery trails and leeches.
